gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour
Class ContourControlHandler

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour.ContourChangeHandler
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.Contour.ContourControlHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
InformationHandler, PropertyChangeHandler, IPreserveState
public class ContourControlHandler
extends ContourChangeHandler
implements InformationHandler

This is a module of a ContourViewComponent that is responsible for maintaining the ViewControls used to control the view component. That is, this class maintains the state information for the controls and listens to other modules of the view component so that the state of the controls is synchronized with the other modules.

DEFAULT_LABEL_EVERY_N_LINES

public static final int DEFAULT_LABEL_EVERY_N_LINES
Specifies that every nth contour line will be labeled by default. The value of this field is 1.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_ENABLE_STYLE_ARR

public static final boolean[] DEFAULT_ENABLE_STYLE_ARR
Specifies which extra line styles will be enabled by default. The value of this field is a three element array where each element has the value false. This means that only the standard line style will be enabled (it is always enabled). The rest of the extra line styles will be disabled.

DEFAULT_COLOR_SCALE

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_COLOR_SCALE
Specifies the default named colorscale used to determine the colors to render the contour lines with. The value of this field is IndexColorMaker.HEATED_OBJECT_SCALE_2.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_INTENSITY

public static final double DEFAULT_INTENSITY
Specifies the default intensity of the colorscale used when coloring the contour plot. The value of this field is 30.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_USE_MANUAL_LEVELS

public static final boolean DEFAULT_USE_MANUAL_LEVELS
Specifies if, by default, the manually entered contour levels or uniformly spaced contour levels will be used when rendering the contour plot. The value of this field is false. That is, by default the uniformly spaced contour levels will be used.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ContourControlHandler

public ContourControlHandler(PropertyChangeConnector connector,
                             InformationCenter center,
                             ContourJPanel panel,
                             boolean useManualLevels)
Constructs a module for a ContourViewComponent that handles working with the view component's controls.

Parameters:
connector - Serves to connect several modules of a ContourViewComponent so that if a property in one module is changed, the other modules are notified.
center - Serves as the central location where the data shared between several modules of a ContourViewComponent is stored.
panel - The panel that is responsible for rendering the contour plot.
useManualLevels - Used to specify if the contour levels entered in the "manual contour levels" control will be used when rendering the contour plot. If true, the manually entered contour levels will be used. Otherwise, the contour levels specified in the control for the uniformly spaced contour levels will be used.

ContourControlHandler

public ContourControlHandler(PropertyChangeConnector connector,
                             InformationCenter center,
                             ContourJPanel panel,
                             float minValue,
                             float maxValue,
                             int numLevels,
                             float[] levels,
                             boolean useManualLevels,
                             int[] styles,
                             boolean[] stylesEnabled,
                             boolean enableLabels,
                             int everyNthLineLabeled,
                             boolean enableFormatting,
                             int numSigFig,
                             java.lang.String colorScale,
                             boolean isDoubleSided,
                             java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
Called to instatiate all of the controls used with this view component.

Parameters:
minValue - This is used to describe how to generate uniformly spaced contour levels. It is the value of the lowest contour level
maxValue - This is used to describe how to generate unformly spaced contour levels. It is the value of the highest uniform contour level.
numLevels - This is used to describe how to generate uniformly spaced contour levels. It specifies the number of contour levels in the group of uniformly spaced contour levels.
levels - This is the list of manually entered contour levels.
useManualLevels - If true the controls used to enter the manually entered contours levels will initially have the focus. If false the controls used to enter the data to generate the uniformly spaced contour levels will have focus.
styles - Specifies the line styles to use when rendering the contour lines. The possible styles are DASHED, DOTTED, ContourJPanel.DASHED_DOTTED, or SOLID. If the length of the array is too short, default values are used. If it is too long, the extra values are ignored. When rendering the contour plot, the renderer cycles through this array to determine the line style to use. In other words, suppose this array has four elements. When the first contour line is rendered, the line style at the index 0 is used. When, the second line is rendered, the line style at index 1 is used. However, when the renderer gets to the fourth contour line, it starts over at the line style at index 0 to determine the style to use.
stylesEnabled - Specifies which line styles are enabled in the array specified by the parameter styles. The length of the array specified by this parameter should be one less than the length of the array specified by the parameter styles. That is because the ith element in this array corresponds to whether or not the style at the (i+1)th element in the styles should be enabled. This is because the first style is always enabled and cannot be disabled. The rest of this array describes the other line styles.
enableLabels - Specifies if the contour lines on the contour plot should be labeled or not.
everyNthLineLabeled - Specifies that every nth in the contour plot should be labeled.
enableFormatting - Specifies in the contour lines on the contour plot should have their labels formatted or not. When the labels are formatted, their values are reflected to a specified number of significant figures.
numSigFig - The number of significant figures to which the contour line's labels should be rounded to.
colorScale - The colorscale to use when rendering the cotour plot.
isDoubleSided - If true, the colorscale specified by the parameter colorScale will be double-sided. If false, it will not be double-sided.
backgroundColor - Specifies the background color to use when rendering the contour plot.
Method Detail

reinit

public void reinit(IVirtualArray2D v2d)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. This method is invoked when the data that is to be displayed by the contour plot has changed. When invoked, this method updates the controls to reflect this new data.

Specified by:
reinit in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
v2d - The new data that is going to be plotted.
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.reinit(IVirtualArray2D)

changeColorScaleName

public void changeColorScaleName(java.lang.String colorscale)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. If the colorscale being used to color the contour plot changes, this method is invoked. When it is invoked, the control for the colorscale is updated to reflect the change.

Overrides:
changeColorScaleName in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
colorscale - The name of the colorscale that will now be used to color the contour plot.
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.changeColorScaleName(String)

changeColorScaleLocation

public void changeColorScaleLocation(java.lang.String location)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. This method is invoked if the location of the colorscale's control changes. When invoked, this method updates the controls so that the colorscale's control is in the correct location.

Overrides:
changeColorScaleLocation in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
location - A string alias describing the new location of the colorscale's control. The value of this parameter should be either:
  • CONTROL_PANEL_LOCATION
  • BELOW_IMAGE_LOCATION
  • RIGHT_IMAGE_LOCATION
  • NONE_LOCATION
See Also:
ContourChangeHandler.changeColorScaleLocation(String)

changeIntensity

public void changeIntensity(double intensity)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. If the intensity on the colorscale used to color the contour plot changes, this method is invoked. When invoked, the controls for the intensity and the colorscale are updated to reflect the change.

Overrides:
changeIntensity in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
intensity - The intensity of the colorscale that is now going to be used to render the contour plot.

ContourChangeHandler.changeIntensity(double)

public void changeIsDoubleSided(boolean isDoubleSided)
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. If the colorscale being used to color the contour plot is modified to be/not be "double-sided", this method is invoked. When invoked, this method updates the colorscale's control to reflect the change.

Overrides:
changeIsDoubleSided in class ContourChangeHandler
Parameters:
isDoubleSided - True if the colorscale used to color the contour plot is now double-sided and false if it isn't.

changeDisplay

public void changeDisplay()
This method is implemented for the ContourChangeHandler class. This method is invoked whenever the display has changed (i.e. become inconsistent) and needs to be updated. When invoked, this method updates the controls to be in a consistent state with the contour plot.

getIsLabelEnabled

public boolean getIsLabelEnabled()
Used to determine if the controls reflect that the contour lines should be labeled when rendering the contour plot.

Returns:
True if the controls reflect that the contour lines should be labeled when the contour plot is rendered and false if the contour lines should not be rendered.

Used to set if the contour lines should be labeled when the contour plot is renered.

Parameters:
enable - True if the contour lines should be labeled when the contour plot is rendered and false if they shouldn't be.

getLabelEvery

public int getLabelEvery()
Used to determine interval between labeled lines on the contour plot as specified by the controls.

Returns:
The interval between labeled lines on the contour plot. For example, if this method returns 4, then every 4th contour line will be labeled.

setLabelEvery

public void setLabelEvery(int nthLine)
Used to set the interval between labeled contour lines on the contour plot.

Parameters:
nthLine - The interval between labeled contour lines on the contour plot. For example, if the value of this parameter is 4, then every 4th contour line will be labeled.

getIsLabelFormattingEnabled

public boolean getIsLabelFormattingEnabled()
Used to determine if the contour line labels should be formatted if they are rendered on the contour image. Note: Even if the contour line labels are disabled, if the controls specify that the contour line labels should be formatted, this method will return true. In this case, if the labels were rendered, they would be formatted. When the labels are formatted they are modified to have the certain number of significant figures.

Returns:
True if the contour line labels on the contour image should be labeled and false if they shouldn't.
See Also:
getNumSigFigs(), setIsLabelEnabled(boolean)

setIsLabelFormattingEnabled

public void setIsLabelFormattingEnabled(boolean enable)
Used to set if the contour line labels on the contour plot should be formatted. Note: This method is closely connected to the methods setNumSigFigs(int) and setLabelEvery(int) and line labels must be enabled for the label formatting to work. When the labels are formatted they are modified to have the certain number of significant figures.

Parameters:
enable - True if the contour line labels should be formatted and false if they shouldn't be.
See Also:
setNumSigFigs(int), getIsLabelEnabled()

getNumSigFigs

public int getNumSigFigs()
Used to access the number of significant figures that will be reflected in the contour line labels on the contour plot.

Returns:
The number of significant figures reflected in the contour plot's line labels.
See Also:
getIsLabelFormattingEnabled(), getIsLabelEnabled()

setNumSigFigs

public void setNumSigFigs(int num)
Used to set the number of significant figures that will be reflected in the contour line labels on the contour plot. Note: This method will modify the control to reflect the parameter given. However, contour line labels and contour line label formatting must be enabled for the contour plot to reflect the changes imposed by this method.

Parameters:
num - The number of significant figures reflected in the contour line labels on the contour plot.

getBackgroundColor

public java.awt.Color getBackgroundColor()
Used to access the background color that is to be used when rendering the contour plot as specified by the controls.

Returns:
The background color that is to be used when rendering the contour plot.

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color color)
Used to set the background color that is to be used when rendering the contour plot.

Parameters:
color - The background color to be used when rendering the contour plot.

setIntensity

public void setIntensity(double intensity)
Used to set the intensity of the colorscale used when coloring the contour plot.

Parameters:
intensity - The intensity of the colorscale used when rendering the contour plot.

getColorScaleIntensity

public double getColorScaleIntensity()
Used to get the intensity of the colorscale used when coloring the contour plot.

Returns:
The intensity of the colorscale used when coloring the contour plot.
